data.title: Monarchs of Portugal
data.meta_description: Read Afonso I (1139 - 1185) from the story Monarchs of Portugal by actorshistoryroyals (Eva) with 1 reads. dukes, monarchy, monarchs. Afonso I (Portuguese pron...
data.text:
Afonso I (Portuguese pronunciation: [ɐˈfõsu]; 1106/1109/1111 – 1185), also called Afonso Henriques, nicknamed the Conqueror (Portuguese: O Conquistador) and the Founder (Portuguese: O Fundador) by the Portuguese, was the first king of Portugal. He achieved the independence of the County of Portugal, establishing a new kingdom and doubling its area with the Reconquista, an objective that he pursued until his death.

King of Portugal

Reign: 25 July 1139 - 6 December 1185

Acclamation: 25 July 1139

Successor: Sancho I

Count of Portugal

Reign: 1112 - 25 July 1139

Predecessor: Henry

Co-Count: Theresa (1112-1128)

Regent: Theresa (1112-1128)

Born: Afonso Henriquez

1106, 25 July 1109, August 1109 or 1111

Guimarães (some argue Viseu)

Died: 6 December 1185 (aged c. 73-79)

Coimbra, Kingdom of Portugal

Burial: Santa Cruz Monastery,

Coimbra, Kingdom of Portugal

Spouse: Matilda of Savoy (m. 1146; died 1157)

Issue: Infante Henry of Portugal.

Urraca, Queen of León.

Teresa, Countess of Flanders.

Infanta Mafalda of Portugal.

Sancho I, King of Portugal.

Infante John of Portugal.

Infanta Sancha of Portugal.

Fernando Afonso of Portugal (ill.).

Urraca Afonso (ill.).

Teresa Afonso, Lady of Bragança and

Chaves (ill.).

Pedro Afonso, Lord of Arega and Pedrógão

(ill.).

House: Burgundy

Father: Henry, Count of Portugal

Mother: Theresa, Countess of Portugal

__________________________________

Matilda of Savoy (French: Mathilde or Maud, Portuguese: Mafalda or Matilde; c. 1125 – 3 December 1157/58) was Queen of Portugal, after her marriage to King Afonso Henriques, the first sovereign of Portugal, whom she married in 1146.

Queen Consort of Portugal

Tenure: May 1146 - 3 December 1157
